citeinfo.title: United States Labor Statistics 2002-2004

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

place.placekt: U.S. Department of Commerce, 1995, Countries, Dependencies, Areas of Special Sovereignty, and Their Principal Administrative Divisions (Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 10-4): Washington, DC, National Institute of Standards and Technology.

U.S. Department of Commerce, 1987, Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of The United States, and Associated Areas (Federal Information Processing Standard 5-2): Washington, DC, National Institute of Standards and Technology.

descript.abstract: This data set portrays labor statistics annual averages for the years 2002 to 2004, shown by county, for the United States and Puerto Rico. The data set was created by merging data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics with a file showing year 2001 county boundaries. Included is the total labor force, the number of employed and unemployed, and the unemployment rate for each county. This is a replacement for the November 2004 Labor Statistics for the United States Annual Averages for 2002 and 2003 data set, with data for 2004 added. This is an updated version of the September 2005 file; values for 2002 and 2003 were updated.
descript.purpose: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the national level, and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:2,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the National Atlas of the United States in the use of these data.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: County Boundaries of the United States, 2001

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

procstep.procdesc:
Year 2002 labor statistics were received from the Bureau of Labor Statistics as a database file. The file was loaded to ArcView, then an attribute field was added and populated with the 5-digit FIPS code for each county.
The 2001 County Boundaries file from the National Atlas was edited to removed polygons associated with the U.S. Virgin Islands and polygons with no county designation (water areas). The edited county boundaries file was joined to the 2002 labor statistics database and the result saved as a new file. Unnecessary attribute fields were deleted and fields were renamed as necessary.

citeinfo.title: 2002 Local Area Unemployment Statistics for the United States

citeinfo.title: Labor Statistics for the United States - Annual Averages for 2002

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

citeinfo.title: 2002 and 2003 Local Area Unemployment Statistics for the United States

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: Labor Statistics for the United States - Annual Averages for 2002 and 2003

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

citeinfo.title: 2004 Local Area Unemployment Statistics for the United States

procstep.procdesc:
Year 2002 and 2003 labor statistics were received from the Bureau of Labor Statistics as MicroSoft Excel files. The 2002 file represents an updated version of the file used for the May 2004 National Atlas data set. The files were loaded to ArcGIS and saved as a single database file. An attribute field was added and populated with the 5-digit FIPS code for each county.
The 2002 labor attributes contained in the May 2004 National Atlas file were deleted. The following county names were edited based on the GNIS database: DeBaca NM, DeKalb AL, DeKalb GA, DeKalb IL, DeKalb MO, DeKalb TN, DeSoto FL, DeSoto MS, DeWitt TX, DuPage IL, LaMoure ND, and Saint Mary's MD. The edited file was joined to the 2002 and 2003 labor statistics database and the result saved as a new file. Values for Kalawao, HI were edited.

Year 2004 labor statistics were received from the Bureau of Labor Statistics as dBASE VI file. The file was loaded to ArcView and an attribute field was added and populated with the 5-digit FIPS code for each county. The file was joined to Atlas_Labor2002_2003.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: Labor Statistics for the United States - Annual Averages for 2002 to 2004

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

citeinfo.title: 2004 Local Area Unemployment Statistics for the United States

procstep.procdesc: Updated labor statistics for the years 2002 and 2003 were received from the Bureau of Labor Statistics as dBASE VI file. The file was loaded to ArcView and joined to Atlas_Labor2002_2004. The updated values were calculated into the existing attributes. The values for areas in Puerto Rico did not change.

dataqual.logic: The map layer was checked for topological consistency using the ArcInfo command BUILD. No other checks for logical consistency were performed on this map layer.
dataqual.complete: This data set includes labor statistics for all 50 States, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico.

cntinfo.cntinst: In addition to the address above there are other ESIC offices throughout the country. A full list of these offices is at http://geography.usgs.gov/esic/esic_index.html

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data.

stdorder.fees: There is no charge for the map layer.
